page.title: 10Wildlife on the Humber Bank
page.content: Wildlife in the Humber Bank area is under threat because of the development of industry. Fred Hunt a life long{conservationist}has recorded and observed the wildlife of the area over many years. The main{habitats}for the plants and animals are the{ {shoreline}the{woodlands}of Burkinshaws Covert and the screen{ {plantations}for the refineries, old brick{ponds}on C.E.G.B land, the{ {fields}and{ditches}and even{within the {factories and industrial sites.}Fred has reported many species of birds from the Wheatear to the Grebe, many plants exist in the woods and railway areas, others like the fox and the badger still annoy the farmers. The shoreline marshes still show a variety of plant species despite the damage to their habitats.
